page.title: 10Haverfordwest New Market
page.content: Haverfordwest Market was opened officially on November 6th 1982 by Mrs Cole, Chairman of preseli District Council. It is situated in a new shopping arcade in Bridge Street overlooking the Western Cleddau river. Stall Holders rent their stalls from Preseli Council. Some of the stalls are lock-up areas and they cost about Â£50 a week. Other stalls are set up daily on trestle type tables and cost Â£1.25 daily per six feet space. Completing the market arcade are seven shops overlooking the river. The market traders travell in from as far as Pembroke but most are local people.
